text: The Pepper Building is a historic commercial building located at Winston- Salem, Forsyth County, North Carolina. It was designed by the architectural firm Northup and O'Brien and built in 1928. It is a six-story, brick building with Art Deco style detailing. It has a flat, parapeted roof and terra cotta decorative elements, including lions' heads and pilasters. The building originally housed a department store. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2014. ==References== Category:Commercial buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Art Deco architecture in North Carolina Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1928 Category:1928 establishments in North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Winston-Salem, North Carolina
title: Pepper Building
